sentences: Nad pidid leppima kokku uue plaani.
context: 'Pidime' is the 1st person plural past tense form of the Estonian verb 'pidama'. It means 'to have to', 'must', or 'to be supposed to'. The word indicates obligation, necessity, or what one should have done in the past. In this case, 'pidime' specifically refers to the first-person plural ('we') in the past tense, meaning 'we had to' or 'we were supposed to'.
